6066595 1-10-24 $5535.15 logo: EVERSOURCE Summary : This image displays the EVERSOURCE company logo, account information, and service details for a utility bill. Logo : • The word "EVERSOURCE" in uppercase sans-serif font. • The "O" in "SOURCE" is stylized as a circle with a blue top half, green middle stripe, and blue bottom half. • No tagline present. Text Elements : • "Account Number: 5179 749 6023" • "Statement Date: 12/15/23" • "Service Provided To: TOWN OF BERLIN PUBLIC GROUNDS" Placement & Dimensions : • Logo is at the top, followed by account and service information in left-aligned text. • All text is in black except for the colored "O" in the logo. Analysis : • The logo uses blue and green to suggest environmental responsibility and energy. • The information below the logo identifies the account holder and billing date, typical for a utility bill header. Summary : This image shows a utility bill summary with itemized charges, payments, and the total amount due by a specified date, including a highlighted current charge. bill summary: Total Amount Due Section : • Original total amount due: $133.35 (crossed out). • New total amount due: $133.35 (not crossed out). • Due date: 02/13/24. Itemized Charges : • Amount Due On 12/11/23: $135.95. • Last Payment Received On 11/22/23: -$72.18. • Balance Forward: $63.77. • Total Current Charges: $69.58 (highlighted in yellow and circled in blue). Design Encodings : • Green background for the total amount due section. • Yellow highlight and blue circle around "Total Current Charges" value. • Strikethrough on the original total amount due. Analysis : • The bill details a previous balance, a payment received, and new charges, resulting in a recalculated total due. • The current charges ($69.58) are visually emphasized, possibly indicating their importance for the current billing cycle. • The total amount due remains $133.35 after accounting for all listed items. Summary : This bar chart displays the daily electric usage history in kilowatt hours (kWh) for each month, alongside the average temperature for each month, over a one-year period. bar chart: # Title & Axes : • Title: "Electric Usage History - Kilowatt Hours (kWh)". • Y-axis: "kWh/Day", ranging from 0 to 5. • X-axis: Months from December to December (13 bars), each labeled with the month and average temperature in °F (e.g., Dec 35°, Jan 38°, ... Dec 40°). # Data Points : • Each bar represents average daily electric usage (kWh/day) for a given month. • December (first): ~4.1 kWh/day, 35°F • January: ~4.0 kWh/day, 38°F • February: ~3.7 kWh/day, 41°F • March: ~3.3 kWh/day, 41°F • April: ~3.7 kWh/day, 50°F • May: ~3.2 kWh/day, 60°F • June: ~3.2 kWh/day, 68°F • July: ~3.2 kWh/day, 72°F • August: ~3.2 kWh/day, 72°F • September: ~3.7 kWh/day, 68°F • October: ~4.6 kWh/day, 58°F • November: ~3.9 kWh/day, 41°F • December (last, green bar): ~4.2 kWh/day, 40°F # Design Encodings : • Bars are gray for all months except the last December, which is green. • Each bar is labeled below with the month and average temperature. • No gridlines or error bars are present. # Distribution & Trends : • Electric usage is higher in colder months (December, January, October, last December). • Usage is lowest in late spring and summer (May–August). • A notable peak occurs in October (~4.6 kWh/day). • The green bar for the last December suggests it may represent a projected or current month. # Analysis : • Electric usage generally increases as average temperature decreases, with the highest usage in colder months and lowest in warmer months. • October shows an anomalous peak in usage despite a moderate temperature (58°F). • The pattern suggests heating is a major driver of electric consumption. • The green bar for the last December may indicate a forecast or current month's data, slightly higher than the previous December. Summary : This figure presents the current charges for electricity, broken down into supply and delivery components, with costs attributed to specific providers and visualized as a stacked bar. bar chart: Title & Axes : • Title: "Current Charges for Electricity". • No explicit axis labels, but the horizontal axis represents cost in dollars ($). • X-axis tick labels: $0, $15, $30, $45, $60, $75. • No Y-axis (single stacked bar). Data Points : • Supply (NEXTERA ENERGY SERVICES CONN): $10.64. • Delivery (Eversource): $58.94. • Total combined cost: $69.58. Design Encodings : • Supply cost is shown in blue. • Delivery cost is shown in green. • Both costs are displayed as adjacent segments of a single horizontal bar, with supply on the left and delivery extending to the right. • Large, bolded dollar amounts above each segment, with provider names and descriptions in smaller text. Distribution & Trends : • The delivery charge ($58.94) is substantially larger than the supply charge ($10.64). • The supply segment occupies a much smaller portion of the bar compared to the delivery segment. Analysis : • The majority of the total electricity charge is due to delivery costs from Eversource, with supply costs from NEXTERA ENERGY SERVICES CONN making up a much smaller fraction. • The visual emphasis and color contrast highlight the disproportionate contribution of delivery to the overall bill. Summary : This image shows a section of a form related to electric supply, containing a purchase order number, date, and signature, as well as supplier contact information. photo: Scene Overview : • Main subject is a filled-out section of a form for electric supply documentation. • The form includes handwritten entries for PO# (240171), Date (1-4-2024), and a signature. • The electric supplier is listed as NEXTERA ENERGY SERVICES CONN, with a Houston, TX address and phone number. • There is a blue circled "MT" written in the upper left. Technical Details : • The form uses red and black printed text, with handwritten black ink entries. • Supplier address: 20455 STATE HIGHWAY 249, HOUSTON TX 77070-2757. • Supplier phone: 800-882-1276. • "PO#", "Date", and "Sig." are pre-printed in red, with handwritten responses. • The signature is a stylized initial or mark, not a full name. Spatial Relationships : • Supplier information is in the upper right. • Form fields are left-aligned, with handwritten entries to the right of each label. • The blue "MT" is in the upper left margin, separate from the main form content. Analysis : • The image documents the completion of a purchase order form for electric supply, with all required fields filled and supplier details clearly visible. The blue "MT" may be an internal note or reviewer mark. Electric Usage Summary This month your average daily electric use was 4.0 kWh This month your usage stayed the same compared to same time last year. 0 % USAGE ⬇️ News For You A new discount for electric bills is available if you have a financial hardship status on your electric account. Based on your household income or receipt of a public assistance benefit, you may be eligible for a 10% or 50% discount off your electric bill per month. For example, if you have a $100 monthly bill, it would be $10 less if you receive a 10% discount or $50 less if you receive the 50% discount. See how to enroll at eversource.com/billhelp. Remit Payment To: Eversource, PO Box 56002, Boston, MA 02205-6002 Please make your check payable to Eversource and consider adding $1 for Operation Fuel. You can also add $2 or $3 when paying your bill online. 100% of your tax-deductible donation provides energy assistance grants. If mailing, please allow up to 5 business days to post. logo: EVERSOURCE • The image displays the EVERSOURCE company logo in uppercase sans-serif letters. • The letter "O" is stylized as a circle divided horizontally into three bands: blue (top), white (middle), and green (bottom). • All other letters are in dark gray. • No tagline or additional text is present. • The logo is centered on a white background. Analysis : • The use of blue and green in the "O" suggests themes of energy, environment, or sustainability, aligning with Eversource's identity as a utility company. Account Number: 5179 749 6023 Non-residential and residential non-hardship customers may be subject to a 1.00% late payment charge if the "Total Amount Due" is not received by 01/12/24.

003055 000046130 TOWN OF BERLIN PUBLIC GROUNDS 15 TOWN FARM LN BERLIN CT 06037-2324 Summary : This image shows a postal barcode and a mailing address for Eversource in Boston, MA. barcode: Barcode Details : • Linear barcode consisting of vertical bars of varying thickness and spacing. • No numeric or alphanumeric string is visible below the barcode. • Barcode is positioned above the address block. • Approximate module count: over 50 bars. • Quiet zone present on both left and right sides. Address Block : • "Eversource" • "PO Box 56002" • "Boston, MA 02205-6002" Analysis : • The barcode is likely a USPS POSTNET or Intelligent Mail barcode used for automated mail sorting. • The address is formatted for mailing to Eversource's PO Box in Boston, MA, with full ZIP+4 code. Summary : This image shows a small, square, high-density 2D barcode above the number "24". barcode: Barcode Details : • Type: 2D matrix barcode (likely DataMatrix or QR, but exact type not specified). • Approximate module count: about 16 × 16 black and white modules. • Quiet zone: present on all sides, especially visible at the bottom. • No visible alphanumeric string within the barcode itself. • Placement: barcode is centered above the number "24". Numeric Annotation : • The number "24" is printed directly below the barcode, centered. Analysis : • The barcode is likely used for identification, tracking, or referencing the item labeled "24". • No company logo, text, or additional annotation is present in the crop. 5179749602353 0000133355 0000069588 Summary : This image shows the Eversource company logo and an account number. logo: Company Name : • "EVERSOURCE" in uppercase, bold sans-serif font. • The "O" in "SOURCE" is stylized as a circle split horizontally: top half blue, middle white stripe, bottom half green. Account Number : • Text "Account Number:" followed by "5179 749 6023" in bold. Analysis : • The logo uses blue and green, likely to evoke environmental or energy themes. • The account number is clearly presented for identification purposes. CE_231215PROD.TXT-6110-000046130 Summary : This image displays a utility bill header from Eversource, including account information, statement date, and service recipient. logo: EVERSOURCE • The logo consists of the word "EVERSOURCE" in uppercase sans-serif font. • The "O" in "SOURCE" is stylized as a circle with a blue top half, green middle stripe, and blue bottom half. • No tagline is present. Account & Service Information : • Account Number: 5179 749 6023 • Customer name key: BERL • Statement Date: 12/15/23 • Service Provided To: TOWN OF BERLIN PUBLIC GROUNDS Analysis : • The logo uses green and blue in the "O" to suggest environmental or energy themes. • The information is formatted for quick reference, typical of a utility bill header. Total Amount Due by 02/13/24 $133.35 Summary : This bar chart shows the monthly electricity supply rate in dollars per kilowatt-hour (kWh) from December through the following December. bar chart: Title & Axes : • No explicit chart title; context indicates "Supply Rate". • Y-axis: "Dollars / kWh", ranging from 0 to 0.1. • X-axis: Months, labeled Dec, Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr, May, Jun, Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec. Data Points : • Each bar represents the supply rate for a given month. • Dec, Jan, Feb, Mar: approximately 0.06 dollars/kWh. • Apr, May, Jun: approximately 0.08 dollars/kWh. • Jul: slightly below 0.08 dollars/kWh. • Aug: approximately 0.08 dollars/kWh. • Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec: approximately 0.07 dollars/kWh. Design Encodings : • Bars are grey except for the final December bar, which is green. • All bars are of equal width; no error bars or additional markers. Distribution & Trends : • Rates are stable at about 0.06 dollars/kWh from December to March. • Rates increase to about 0.08 dollars/kWh from April to June. • Slight dip in July, then return to 0.08 in August. • Rates decrease to about 0.07 dollars/kWh from September to December. Analysis : • The supply rate is lowest in winter and early spring, peaks in late spring and summer, and then decreases slightly in the fall. • The green bar for the final December may indicate a forecast or special status. • No outliers or abrupt changes; the pattern is seasonal with a clear mid-year peak. Summary : This bar chart shows the monthly maximum demand profile over a one-year period, highlighting a significant dip in March and otherwise consistent demand levels. bar chart: # Title & Axes : • Title: "Demand Profile" • Y-axis: "Max. Demand" (range: 0 to 2.5, tick marks at 0, 0.5, 1.0, 1.5, 2.0, 2.5) • X-axis: Months labeled from Dec, Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr, May, Jun, Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec # Data Points : • Dec: ~2.0 • Jan: ~2.0 • Feb: ~2.0 • Mar: ~1.0 • Apr: ~2.0 • May: ~2.0 • Jun: ~2.0 • Jul: ~2.0 • Aug: ~2.0 • Sep: ~2.0 • Oct: ~2.0 • Nov: ~2.0 • Dec (second occurrence): ~2.0 (bar is green, others are grey) # Design Encodings : • All bars are grey except the final December bar, which is green. • Uniform bar width and spacing. • No gridlines or additional annotations. # Distribution & Trends : • Demand is stable at approximately 2.0 for all months except March. • March shows a marked decrease to approximately 1.0. • The final December bar is visually distinguished in green. # Analysis : • The demand profile is highly consistent except for a single, pronounced dip in March. • The green bar for December may indicate a forecast, target, or special status, but this is not specified in the image. • No other outliers or trends are visible; the pattern is otherwise flat. Summary : This image shows a small, square, high-contrast black-and-white pattern consistent with a 2D barcode, likely a DataMatrix code. barcode: Type & Structure : • Barcode type: DataMatrix (square, grid-like pattern). • Approximate module count: 14 × 14 modules. • Quiet zone: Present on all sides, approximately 1 module wide. Text & Numeric Content : • No visible numeric or alphanumeric string; content is encoded in the pattern and not human-readable in this image. Placement & Dimensions : • Barcode is centered in the image, with a white margin (quiet zone) on all sides. • Aspect ratio: 1:1 (square). Analysis : • The barcode is machine-readable and intended for compact data encoding; no visible text or logo is present. • The pattern and quiet zone are typical for DataMatrix codes used in labeling small items or components. logo: EVERSOURCE
Summary : This image displays the EVERSOURCE company logo, account information, and service details for a utility bill.

Logo :
  • The word "EVERSOURCE" in uppercase sans-serif font.
  • The "O" in "SOURCE" is stylized as a circle with a blue top half, green middle stripe, and blue bottom half.
  • No tagline present.

Text Elements :
  • "Account Number: 5179 749 6023"
  • "Statement Date: 12/15/23"
  • "Service Provided To: TOWN OF BERLIN PUBLIC GROUNDS"

Placement & Dimensions :
  • Logo is at the top, followed by account and service information in left-aligned text.
  • All text is in black except for the colored "O" in the logo.

Analysis :
  • The logo uses blue and green to suggest environmental responsibility and energy.
  • The information below the logo identifies the account holder and billing date, typical for a utility bill header.

Summary : This image shows a utility bill summary with itemized charges, payments, and the total amount due by a specified date, including a highlighted current charge.

bill summary:
  Total Amount Due Section :
    • Original total amount due: $133.35 (crossed out).
    • New total amount due: $133.35 (not crossed out).
    • Due date: 02/13/24.

  Itemized Charges :
    • Amount Due On 12/11/23: $135.95.
    • Last Payment Received On 11/22/23: -$72.18.
    • Balance Forward: $63.77.
    • Total Current Charges: $69.58 (highlighted in yellow and circled in blue).

  Design Encodings :
    • Green background for the total amount due section.
    • Yellow highlight and blue circle around "Total Current Charges" value.
    • Strikethrough on the original total amount due.

Analysis :
  • The bill details a previous balance, a payment received, and new charges, resulting in a recalculated total due.
  • The current charges ($69.58) are visually emphasized, possibly indicating their importance for the current billing cycle.
  • The total amount due remains $133.35 after accounting for all listed items.

Summary : This bar chart displays the daily electric usage history in kilowatt hours (kWh) for each month, alongside the average temperature for each month, over a one-year period.

bar chart:

# Title & Axes :
  • Title: "Electric Usage History - Kilowatt Hours (kWh)".
  • Y-axis: "kWh/Day", ranging from 0 to 5.
  • X-axis: Months from December to December (13 bars), each labeled with the month and average temperature in °F (e.g., Dec 35°, Jan 38°, ... Dec 40°).

# Data Points :
  • Each bar represents average daily electric usage (kWh/day) for a given month.
  • December (first): ~4.1 kWh/day, 35°F
  • January: ~4.0 kWh/day, 38°F
  • February: ~3.7 kWh/day, 41°F
  • March: ~3.3 kWh/day, 41°F
  • April: ~3.7 kWh/day, 50°F
  • May: ~3.2 kWh/day, 60°F
  • June: ~3.2 kWh/day, 68°F
  • July: ~3.2 kWh/day, 72°F
  • August: ~3.2 kWh/day, 72°F
  • September: ~3.7 kWh/day, 68°F
  • October: ~4.6 kWh/day, 58°F
  • November: ~3.9 kWh/day, 41°F
  • December (last, green bar): ~4.2 kWh/day, 40°F

# Design Encodings :
  • Bars are gray for all months except the last December, which is green.
  • Each bar is labeled below with the month and average temperature.
  • No gridlines or error bars are present.

# Distribution & Trends :
  • Electric usage is higher in colder months (December, January, October, last December).
  • Usage is lowest in late spring and summer (May–August).
  • A notable peak occurs in October (~4.6 kWh/day).
  • The green bar for the last December suggests it may represent a projected or current month.

# Analysis :
  • Electric usage generally increases as average temperature decreases, with the highest usage in colder months and lowest in warmer months.
  • October shows an anomalous peak in usage despite a moderate temperature (58°F).
  • The pattern suggests heating is a major driver of electric consumption.
  • The green bar for the last December may indicate a forecast or current month's data, slightly higher than the previous December.

Summary : This figure presents the current charges for electricity, broken down into supply and delivery components, with costs attributed to specific providers and visualized as a stacked bar.

bar chart:
Title & Axes :
  • Title: "Current Charges for Electricity".
  • No explicit axis labels, but the horizontal axis represents cost in dollars ($).
  • X-axis tick labels: $0, $15, $30, $45, $60, $75.
  • No Y-axis (single stacked bar).

Data Points :
  • Supply (NEXTERA ENERGY SERVICES CONN): $10.64.
  • Delivery (Eversource): $58.94.
  • Total combined cost: $69.58.

Design Encodings :
  • Supply cost is shown in blue.
  • Delivery cost is shown in green.
  • Both costs are displayed as adjacent segments of a single horizontal bar, with supply on the left and delivery extending to the right.
  • Large, bolded dollar amounts above each segment, with provider names and descriptions in smaller text.

Distribution & Trends :
  • The delivery charge ($58.94) is substantially larger than the supply charge ($10.64).
  • The supply segment occupies a much smaller portion of the bar compared to the delivery segment.

Analysis :
  • The majority of the total electricity charge is due to delivery costs from Eversource, with supply costs from NEXTERA ENERGY SERVICES CONN making up a much smaller fraction.
  • The visual emphasis and color contrast highlight the disproportionate contribution of delivery to the overall bill.

Summary : This image shows a section of a form related to electric supply, containing a purchase order number, date, and signature, as well as supplier contact information.

photo:

  • Main subject is a filled-out section of a form for electric supply documentation.

  • The electric supplier is listed as NEXTERA ENERGY SERVICES CONN, with a Houston, TX address and phone number.

  • Form fields are left-aligned, with handwritten entries to the right of each label.

Analysis :

Electric Usage Summary

This month your average daily electric use was  
4.0 kWh

This month your usage stayed the same compared to same time last year.

0 %  
USAGE ⬇️

News For You

A new discount for electric bills is available if you have a financial hardship status on your electric account. Based on your household income or receipt of a public assistance benefit, you may be eligible for a 10% or 50% discount off your electric bill per month. For example, if you have a $100 monthly bill, it would be $10 less if you receive a 10% discount or $50 less if you receive the 50% discount. See how to enroll at eversource.com/billhelp.
Remit Payment To: Eversource, PO Box 56002, Boston, MA 02205-6002

Please make your check payable to Eversource and consider adding $1 for Operation Fuel. You can also add $2 or $3 when paying your bill online. 100% of your tax-deductible donation provides energy assistance grants. If mailing, please allow up to 5 business days to post.

Summary : This bar chart shows the monthly electricity supply rate in dollars per kilowatt-hour (kWh) from December through the following December.

bar chart:
Title & Axes :
  • No explicit chart title; context indicates "Supply Rate".
  • Y-axis: "Dollars / kWh", ranging from 0 to 0.1.
  • X-axis: Months, labeled Dec, Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr, May, Jun, Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec.

Data Points :
  • Each bar represents the supply rate for a given month.
  • Dec, Jan, Feb, Mar: approximately 0.06 dollars/kWh.
  • Apr, May, Jun: approximately 0.08 dollars/kWh.
  • Jul: slightly below 0.08 dollars/kWh.
  • Aug: approximately 0.08 dollars/kWh.
  • Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec: approximately 0.07 dollars/kWh.

Design Encodings :
  • Bars are grey except for the final December bar, which is green.
  • All bars are of equal width; no error bars or additional markers.

Distribution & Trends :
  • Rates are stable at about 0.06 dollars/kWh from December to March.
  • Rates increase to about 0.08 dollars/kWh from April to June.
  • Slight dip in July, then return to 0.08 in August.
  • Rates decrease to about 0.07 dollars/kWh from September to December.

Analysis :
  • The supply rate is lowest in winter and early spring, peaks in late spring and summer, and then decreases slightly in the fall.
  • The green bar for the final December may indicate a forecast or special status.
  • No outliers or abrupt changes; the pattern is seasonal with a clear mid-year peak.

Summary : This bar chart shows the monthly maximum demand profile over a one-year period, highlighting a significant dip in March and otherwise consistent demand levels.

bar chart:

Summary : This image shows a small, square, high-contrast black-and-white pattern consistent with a 2D barcode, likely a DataMatrix code.

barcode:  
Type & Structure :  
  • Barcode type: DataMatrix (square, grid-like pattern).  
  • Approximate module count: 14 × 14 modules.  
  • Quiet zone: Present on all sides, approximately 1 module wide.  

Text & Numeric Content :  
  • No visible numeric or alphanumeric string; content is encoded in the pattern and not human-readable in this image.  

Placement & Dimensions :  
  • Barcode is centered in the image, with a white margin (quiet zone) on all sides.  
  • Aspect ratio: 1:1 (square).  

Analysis :  
  • The barcode is machine-readable and intended for compact data encoding; no visible text or logo is present.  
  • The pattern and quiet zone are typical for DataMatrix codes used in labeling small items or components.
